Jewish Labor Committee Records, Part III

Michael Perry's papers, primarily from his term as Executive Director, focus on the Jewish community's support of the labor movement and other issues affecting organized labor, such as the role of religion in the labor movement. The JLC's involvement in civil rights advocacy, JLC administration, and the JLC's efforts abroad in Israel and Eastern Europe are also documented in this subseries.

Michael Perry began working for the JLC in 1981 as the director of the Philadelphia branch. He began working in the JLC's New York headquarters in 1985, first as Director of Programming, later as Assistant Director, and finally as Executive Director. Prior to his employment with the JLC, Perry was a Staff Representative for the American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees (AFSCME) and, from 1979 to 1981, was the Technical Services Coordinator of an employment and training program for the AFL-CIO Great Lakes Regional Council. Perry currently serves as chair of the JLC's Chicago chapter.
